It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of a dense cluster of small, yellowish flowers surrounded by modified leaves. Native to specific regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its foliage is typically narrow and grass-like, with a fibrous structure that aids in water retention. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
